title: How did the creators of South Park got the TV show going? - Quora

response.answer_text: They made a short animation with craft paper. They were about Jesus fighting Santa while the band watched. It was before streaming video, but it still spread like wild fire. Pirated VHS and CD were passed from person to person. That caught the attention of some people, that and the fact that their student movie “Cannibal the Musical” was an actual movie and not an “artistic mess”, so they were given a shot at making the first season of South Park. The rest is history.

Thanks to Wikipedia for this answer: Spirit of Christmas is the name of two different animated short films made by Trey Parker and Matt Stone. They are precursors to the animated series South Park. To differentiate the two, they are often referred to as Jesus vs. Frosty (1992) and Jesus vs. Santa (1995). The Spirit of Christmas (short film)
